title: Ollivier-Ricci curvature of regular graphs
abstract:
We derive explicit formulas for the Lin-Lu-Yau curvature and the
Ollivier-Ricci curvature in terms of graph parameters and an optimal
assignment. Utilizing these precise expressions, we examine the relationship
between the Lin-Lu-Yau curvature and the 0-Ollivier-Ricci curvature, resulting
in an equality condition on regular graphs. This condition allows us to
characterize edges that are bone idle in regular graphs of girth four and to
construct a family of bone idle graphs with this girth. We then use our
formulas to provide an efficient implementation of the Ollivier-Ricci curvature
on regular graphs, enabling us to identify all bone idle, regular graphs with
fewer than 15 vertices. Moreover, we establish a rigidity theorem for cocktail
party graphs, proving that a regular graph is a cocktail party graph if and
only if its Lin-Lu-Yau curvature is equal to one. We conclude this work by
presenting a condition on the degree of a regular graph that guarantees
positive Ricci curvature.
